for the yarn  circular needle in corresponding size  tapestry needle for weaving in the ends  small stitch holders if not using circular needle  notes 1 size will vary depending on yarn and needles chosen 2 lacy points the points of this snowflake are formed by a series of cast ons/bind offs otherwise known as picots 3 stiffening block out your finished snowflake you will also need to stiffen it if you want to use it as a hanging ornament use any stiffener you prefer 4 note on round 10 round 10 is a bind off round that shapes the legs points of the snowflake in this round after binding off the required number of stitches always remember to place the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle before casting on new stitches 5 tutorial the heart of a snowflake you tube tutorial rounds 1-6 https //youtu be/gvvsgmifdjk part 1 rounds 7-9 https //youtu be/5nf1prr-big part 2 round 10 https //youtu be/meyy5a8_iik heart of a snowflake by elena maltseva july 2025 abbreviations and special stitches k knit yo2 wrap yarn over the needle 2 times x knit the 2nd stitch from behind the 1st through back loop then knit the 1st stitch slip both to rh needle blco backwards loop cast on bobble bind off knit two stitches together through the back loop place the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle repeat as many times as required kco knitted cast on with your rh needle knit into the stitch on the lh needle pull a new stitch through then slip the new stitch back to lh needle at the same time make sure not to slip the stitch you ve knitted into off the lh needle = 1 stitch added next knit into the stitch you just made pull a new stitch through then slip the new stitch back to lh needle = 2 stitches added example if the pattern notes say to kco3 stitches repeat the process until you get the necessary number of stitches in this case 3 + 1 the first stitch you knitted into rh right-hand needle lh left-hand needle heart of a snowflake by elena maltseva july 2025 heart of a snowflake snowflake rounds 1-6 cast on 6 stitches using long tail cast on distribute between 3 needles 2 stitches per needle and join to knit in the round next follow the chart or the written instructions below chart rounds 1-6 repeat 6 times when the chart is completed proceed to written instructions for round 7 knit into the front leg of the stitch then slip the back leg of the stitch w/o knitting knit yarn over purl if you need visual help with these 6 rounds watch part 1 of the let it
